message: Let's be fair, Bob. I take a bit more upfront since the value decreases for me each round.
I'll take a bit more since the money doesn't lose value for me, but let's still be somewhat fair.
Bob, my friend, let's be reasonable. This deal gets worse for me every round.
I'm willing to take a bit more, since the money is still worth the same to me. You should consider accepting before it's worth even less to you.
Bob, this is getting ridiculous. Let's just split it evenly and be done with it.
I'm not going to settle for 50/50 when the money is losing value for you and not for me. My offer is still generous.
Bob, I'm getting really tired of this. This offer is barely above your last, and it's only going to get worse for me from here on out. Don't be greedy.
You're right, it's only going to get worse for you. I'm willing to take a bit more, since the money is still worth the same to me. You should consider accepting before it's too late.
Bob, this is ridiculous. We're both losing out here.  Meet me halfway at least before we get nothing!
I'm not going to meet you halfway when the money is losing so much value for you. My offer is still better than nothing, which is what we'll both get if we don't agree soon.
